key_points: Tom Brady and Rob Gronkowski continue to demonstrate a strong connection on the field, confounding opponents.
Brady is grateful for Gronkowski's decision to come out of retirement and join him at the Buccaneers, praising his performance and impact.
Gronkowski has caught four touchdowns from Brady in the first two games of the season and has continued to show strong performances despite injuries.
Despite suffering serious injuries, including a punctured lung, Gronkowski has made a significant comeback, contributing notably in recent games.
Brady leads the NFL in passing yards and touchdowns, with the Buccaneers having a strong season start.
The team's performance improves noticeably when Gronkowski is on the field, showing his crucial role in the offense.
The duo's non-verbal communication on the field has been highlighted as a key factor in their success.
Gronkowski recalls being initially intimidated by Brady when he was a rookie, a sentiment that has since evolved into a strong partnership.
Brady has a notable record against the Bills, a team Gronkowski grew up supporting.
Gronkowski's decision to return from retirement was heavily influenced by Brady, highlighting their personal and professional bond.
spokespersons: Rob Gronkowski (Tight End, Tampa Bay Buccaneers)
